Robin Wu wrote:

> Hi,
>  
> I download heritrix-1.0.0 source released on Augest 6th, and build it 
> with maven 1.0, IBM Java SDK 1.4.2 on Windows XP.  But get some errors 
> when testing.
>  
> here're parts of the log.
>
The below junit test failures look like "2.3. [ 984390 ] Build fails: 
'rws' mode and Mac OS X interact badly" in Known Limitations (See 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/limitations.html).  Try the 
suggested workaround.

FYI: None of the junit tests have network dependencies.

To make heritrix crawl via a proxy, you do not need to edit code.  In 
the settings screen, if you have advanced settings enabled, you'll see 
two text boxes in the FetchHTTP section: One is for the proxy hostname 
and the other for proxy port.

Yours,
St.Ack

> test:test:
> ...

> BUILD FAILED
>  
> I think ExtractorHTMLTest error is due to the network. My pc access 
> the internet via a proxy. And I add my proxy setting in FetchHttp.java 
> as follows, but do not work.
>  
>         e = addElementToDefinition(new SimpleType(ATTR_HTTP_PROXY_HOST,
>             "Proxy hostname (set only if needed)", "172.28.88.2"));
>         e.setExpertSetting(true);
>         e = addElementToDefinition(new SimpleType(ATTR_HTTP_PROXY_PORT,
>             "Proxy port (set only if needed)", "80"));
>         e.setExpertSetting(true);
>  
>  
> I wonder how should I set the proxy, and I also have no ideas about 
> the other errors.
>  
> thanks
